column3: Description
column4: Test Steps
column5: Expected Results

column3: Verify connectivity between regional Virtual WAN hubs
column4: 1. Deploy primary and secondary hubs 2. Configure hub-to-hub routing 3. Test connectivity from hub1 to hub2 4. Verify routing tables
column5: Successful connectivity between all hubs with <50ms latency; routing tables correctly populated

column3: Validate VPN connectivity from branch sites to Virtual WAN hub
column4: 1. Configure VPN site in Virtual WAN 2. Configure on-premises VPN device 3. Establish VPN tunnel 4. Test data transfer
column5: VPN tunnel establishes successfully; stable connection with <2% packet loss

column3: Test ExpressRoute circuit connectivity to Virtual WAN hub
column4: 1. Provision ExpressRoute circuit 2. Connect circuit to Virtual WAN hub 3. Configure BGP peering 4. Verify route propagation
column5: ExpressRoute circuit connected; BGP peers established; routes advertised correctly

column3: Validate Azure Firewall inspects traffic between spokes and to internet
column4: 1. Deploy Azure Firewall in hub 2. Configure firewall rules 3. Send test traffic 4. Review firewall logs
column5: All traffic routed through firewall; rules applied correctly; logs captured

column3: Test virtual network connections to Virtual WAN hub
column4: 1. Create spoke VNet 2. Connect VNet to Virtual WAN hub 3. Test connectivity from spoke to other resources 4. Verify effective routes
column5: VNet successfully connected to hub; resources accessible across spokes via hub

column3: Validate remote user VPN connectivity
column4: 1. Configure P2S VPN gateway 2. Generate client certificates 3. Connect remote client 4. Test access to hub resources
column5: Remote clients connect successfully; access to hub and spoke resources functional

column3: Test BGP routing between on-premises and Azure Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Configure BGP on VPN device 2. Establish BGP peering 3. Advertise routes 4. Verify route tables in Azure
column5: BGP peers established; routes propagated correctly; traffic uses optimal paths

column3: Validate custom routing policies in Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Create custom route table 2. Define custom routes 3. Associate with connections 4. Test traffic flow
column5: Custom routes applied successfully; traffic routed according to policy

column3: Test VNet connectivity across regions through Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Create VNets in different regions 2. Connect to respective hubs 3. Test cross-region connectivity 4. Measure latency
column5: Cross-region VNet communication functional; latency within acceptable range

column3: Validate DNS name resolution across Virtual WAN topology
column4: 1. Configure Azure DNS or custom DNS 2. Create DNS records 3. Test resolution from different locations 4. Verify DNS forwarding
column5: DNS resolution functional across all connected networks; custom domains resolve correctly

column3: Test NSG rules on subnets connected to Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Configure NSG rules 2. Associate with subnets 3. Test allowed traffic 4. Test blocked traffic
column5: NSG rules enforced correctly; allowed traffic passes; blocked traffic denied

column3: Verify gateway scaling for increased throughput
column4: 1. Configure initial scale units 2. Generate baseline traffic 3. Increase scale units 4. Test increased capacity
column5: Gateway scales successfully; throughput increases proportionally to scale units

column3: left
column4: left
column5: left

column3: Description
column4: Test Steps
column5: Expected Results

column3: Establish baseline performance metrics for Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Configure monitoring tools 2. Generate typical traffic load 3. Measure latency and throughput 4. Document baseline metrics
column5: Baseline established for latency (<50ms inter-hub) and throughput (95% of gateway capacity)

column3: Test maximum throughput capacity of VPN gateways
column4: 1. Configure VPN connections 2. Generate maximum traffic load 3. Measure sustained throughput 4. Identify bottlenecks
column5: VPN gateway achieves rated throughput based on scale units; no packet loss under sustained load

column3: Validate ExpressRoute circuit bandwidth utilization
column4: 1. Generate traffic through ExpressRoute 2. Monitor bandwidth usage 3. Test at different traffic levels 4. Verify QoS policies
column5: ExpressRoute utilizes full circuit bandwidth; QoS policies applied correctly

column3: Test Virtual WAN with maximum number of concurrent connections
column4: 1. Establish baseline connections 2. Gradually increase connections 3. Monitor performance 4. Identify scaling limits
column5: Virtual WAN handles maximum concurrent connections without degradation

column3: Measure latency between Virtual WAN hubs under various loads
column4: 1. Deploy hubs in target regions 2. Generate traffic at different loads 3. Measure latency continuously 4. Compare to SLA
column5: Inter-hub latency within SLA (<50ms for regional; <150ms for global)

column3: Assess performance impact of Azure Firewall on traffic flow
column4: 1. Test traffic without firewall 2. Enable firewall inspection 3. Test with firewall 4. Compare metrics
column5: Firewall adds <10ms latency; maintains throughput within firewall capacity limits

column3: Measure time to failover between redundant paths
column4: 1. Establish redundant connections 2. Simulate primary path failure 3. Measure failover time 4. Verify traffic continuity
column5: Failover completes within 30 seconds; minimal packet loss during transition

column3: Validate Virtual WAN availability meets SLA requirements
column4: 1. Monitor uptime continuously 2. Document all outages 3. Calculate availability percentage 4. Review against SLA
column5: Virtual WAN availability meets Azure SLA of 99.95% for hubs

column3: Test monitoring system response time and alert delivery
column4: 1. Configure monitoring and alerts 2. Trigger alert conditions 3. Measure detection time 4. Verify notification delivery
column5: Alerts triggered within 5 minutes of condition; notifications delivered to all channels

column3: Assess impact of configuration changes on active connections
column4: 1. Establish baseline connections 2. Apply configuration change 3. Monitor connection status 4. Measure disruption
column5: Configuration changes applied without disrupting existing connections

column3: Test performance of monitoring queries on large datasets
column4: 1. Ingest significant log volume 2. Execute common queries 3. Measure query response time 4. Optimize as needed
column5: Queries return results within 30 seconds for 30-day data range

column3: Validate traffic distribution across multi-region deployment
column4: 1. Deploy hubs in multiple regions 2. Generate distributed traffic 3. Monitor traffic patterns 4. Verify load distribution
column5: Traffic distributes according to routing policies; no single hub overloaded

column3: Description
column4: Test Steps
column5: Expected Results

column3: Business users validate branch office connectivity to Azure resources
column4: 1. Connect from branch office 2. Access Azure applications 3. Test file transfers 4. Verify application performance
column5: Branch users access Azure resources without issues; performance meets expectations

column3: Remote employees validate Point-to-Site VPN functionality
column4: 1. Install VPN client 2. Connect to Azure 3. Access required applications 4. Perform daily work tasks
column5: Remote workers connect successfully; access all required resources; performance acceptable

column3: Validate business application performance across Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Access line-of-business applications 2. Perform typical transactions 3. Test during peak hours 4. Compare to baseline
column5: Applications perform at or better than pre-Virtual WAN baseline; no user complaints

column3: Business users validate internet access through Azure Firewall
column4: 1. Access internet from branch offices 2. Test various websites and services 3. Verify security policies applied 4. Assess performance
column5: Internet access functional with security policies enforced; browsing performance acceptable

column3: Test collaboration tools across sites connected via Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Initiate Teams video call across sites 2. Share files between locations 3. Test real-time collaboration 4. Assess quality
column5: Collaboration tools work seamlessly; video quality good; file sharing fast

column3: Validate database connectivity and performance from branch sites
column4: 1. Connect to Azure SQL databases 2. Execute typical queries 3. Test during business hours 4. Measure response times
column5: Database access reliable; query performance within acceptable range; no timeouts

column3: IT staff validate management and monitoring capabilities
column4: 1. Access network management consoles 2. Review network topology 3. Test monitoring dashboards 4. Create test alerts
column5: Network management tools provide needed visibility; dashboards intuitive; alerts functional

column3: Security team validates firewall and threat detection capabilities
column4: 1. Review firewall logs and rules 2. Test threat detection 3. Simulate security incident 4. Verify response workflows
column5: Security tools provide adequate visibility; threat detection functional; incident response effective

column3: Test process for connecting new branch site to Virtual WAN
column4: 1. Follow onboarding procedures 2. Configure new site 3. Establish connectivity 4. Validate access
column5: New site onboarding process clear and efficient; connectivity established within expected timeframe

column3: Validate network incident detection and response processes
column4: 1. Simulate network issue 2. Follow incident response procedures 3. Test escalation 4. Measure resolution time
column5: Incident detected promptly; procedures clear; escalation works; resolution timely

column3: Users validate experience during primary path failover
column4: 1. Establish normal connectivity 2. Simulate primary path failure 3. Observe failover 4. Assess user impact
column5: Failover transparent to users or minimal disruption; connectivity restored quickly

column3: IT staff validate operational documentation completeness
column4: 1. Review network documentation 2. Follow operational procedures 3. Test runbooks 4. Provide feedback
column5: Documentation complete and accurate; procedures clear; runbooks effective for operations
